responses.rationale: Reports counts ('at least 26 states') and duration ('nearly a year') using standard verbs ('have been found', 'has been circulating').
Reports numerical metrics ('total number of birds killed', '22 million', '13 million', '18 million') using standard verbs ('to correct').
Reports numerical metrics ('total number of birds killed', '22 million', '13 million', '18 million') using standard verbs ('was updated', 'to correct').
Uses the verb 'jumped' to describe the change in sales figures, which is arguably a vivid verb, not a standard descriptive verb like 'increased' or 'rose'.
Reports counts of illnesses by severity ('Fourteen illnesses', 'seven were fatal', 'six were mild', 'eight didn't have any symptoms') using standard verbs ('were').
Does not primarily report numerical metrics (prices, economic data, counts, etc.).
